articles.author: AAP
articles.title: Shark who mauled bodyboarder a great white
articles.summary: BIOLOGISTS believe the shark that attacked a bodyboarder at Lighthouse Beach, Port Macquarie over the weekend was a 2.7m great white.

articles.author: By Evan Schwarten
articles.title: Fortescue banks on Chinese stimulus
articles.summary: FORTESCUE Metals expects China's stimulus efforts to help boost demand for iron ore, following an 88 per cent slide in its full year profit.

articles.author: AAP
articles.title: No assault charge for NSW Labor boss
articles.summary: POLICE have declined to charge NSW Labor's most senior official, Jamie Clements, over an alleged assault on a parliamentary staffer in parliament.

articles.author: By Karlis Salna
articles.title: Monis 'never seen at any Sydney mosques'
articles.summary: THE inquest into the Sydney siege has heard that claims by gunman Man Haron Monis about his standing in the Muslim community were likely to be false.

articles.author: AAP
articles.title: New SA plant may employ Holden workers
articles.summary: A NEW food processing plant may be built in Adelaide's north and could eventually provide jobs for Holden workers looking for work over the next few years.

articles.author: AAP
articles.title: Heydon delays ruling on standing aside
articles.summary: A DECISION on whether unions royal commissioner Dyson Heydon stands aside won't be delivered on Tuesday.

articles.author: AAP
articles.title: Masterchef judge sued for unpaid bills
articles.summary: MASTERCHEF judge Gary Mehigan is being sued for more than $167,000 over unpaid invoices for building a Melbourne events venue.

articles.author: AAP
articles.title: SA premier defends minister's travel
articles.summary: SOUTH Australian Premier Jay Weatherill has defended his tourism minister against criticism of his travel spending.

articles.author: Simone Ziaziaris
articles.title: No subsidy for Meningococcal B vaccine
articles.summary: PARENTS who wish to vaccinate their child against meningococcal B will be faced with a pricey bill after it was rejected by the government's PBAC.

articles.author: By Annette Blackwell
articles.title: Pope Francis has 'not' shown leadership
articles.summary: RETIRED bishop Geoffrey Robinson has told a royal commission that papal leadership on combating the abuse of minors has never been up to scratch.
